detaileddescription.para: This defines the 4 bits shift

This will be used locally for bitwise operations
Value 4
This defines the 8 bits shift

This will be used locally for bitwise operations
Value 8
This defines the 16 bits shift

This will be used locally for bitwise operations
Value 16
This defines a 4 bits lsb mask

This will be used locally for bitwise operations
Value 0x0F
This defines a 8 bits lsb mask

This will be used locally for bitwise operations
Value 0xFF
This defines the data length of the DiagInfo frame for 1 DTC

This will be used to check and extract the DTC(s)
Value 0x04
This defines the data length of the DiagInfo frame for 2 DTCs

This will be used to check and extract if a second DTC exists
Value 0x08
This defines the value for DTC Diagnostic Info SPI Frame, resync request

DiagnosticInfoData is an array of 5 uint16: 1 byte representing the Header (4bits InofID + 4bits Info length), and max. 9 bytes representing the Diagnostic Data. The first Header byte defines what kind of diagnostic information is provided in the diagnostic data. For the DTC Resync Request InfoID = 0x07
Value 0x7000
This defines the value for DTC Diagnostic Info SPI Frame, CRC32 calculation request

DiagnosticInfoData is an array of 5 uint16: 1 byte representing the Header (4bits InofID + 4bits Info length), and max. 9 bytes representing the Diagnostic Data. The first Header byte defines what kind of diagnostic information is provided in the diagnostic data. For the CRC32 request the first two bytes will be filled with: Byte 0: 0x91 For the CRC32 calculation Request InfoID = 0x09 and the data length is 1. Byte 1: 0x11 Logical block ID for RL78. See requirement SWR_ICAS1_GW_21244
Value 0x9111
This defines the value of the HeaderID byte of Diagnostic Info SPI Frame for sending the HW version.

DiagnosticInfoData is an array of 5 uint16. The first byte is the the Header (4bits InofID + 4bits Info length) and this byte defines what kind of diagnostic information is provided in the diagnostic data. For the HW version the value of this byte is as follows: 4 bits InfoID: value 8 for the HW Version 4 bits Data Length: value 3 (representing the 3 ASCII coded values for the Hardware VersionPlatform, VersionHigh and VersionLow)
Value 0x83
This defines a mask for the 2nd byte of a uint16 data type

This will be used locally for bitwise operations
Value 0xFF00
This defines the value for setting a flag to OFF

This is used locally to reset the flags - SysWDDiagnosis_Flags_s
Value: 0
This defines the value for setting a flag to ON

This is used locally to set the flags - SysWDDiagnosis_Flags_s
Value: 1
This defines the necessary length for the buffers when storing and sending the DiagInfo data.

The Diagnostic Info uses 10 bytes - 1 byte representing the Header (4bits InofID + 4bits Info length), and max. 9 bytes representing the Diagnostic Data - it could be SW, FBL version, DTCs, Voltage, etc. This is used locally to define the necessary buffers for receiving and sending the data to RL78.
Value: 5 The buffers SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] and SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Tx[] are of type uint16
This defines the value of the Diagnostic Data length for CRC32, FBL and SW version.

This is used locally to define the buffers for storing the FBL and SW version received from RL78, and also to check if the length is correct in functions SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78FBLVersion() SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78SWVersion() and SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() when processing the data.
Value: 4 SW and FBL version are 4 bytes long, representing the 4 ASCII characters
This defines the value of the Diagnostic Data length for the HW version.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_ReadRL78HWVersion() when copying the RL78 hardware version in the variable given as parameter. Only the last two bytes received from HardwareVersion component are relevant representing the high and low ASCII values of the board HW version.
Value: 2
This defines the value of the Diagnostic Data length for Temperature.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() to check the correct length of the data when the header ID indicates that contains Temperature values.
Value: 2
This defines the value of the Diagnostic Data length for HW feedback.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() to check the correct length of the data when the header ID indicates that contains HW feedback value.
Value: 1
This defines the number of DTCs that could be received from RL78.

This is used locally to declare and define the DTC list and also to iterate trough all the defined DTC IDs when finding which DTC should be handled.
Value: There are 17 DTCs for ICAS1evo - SYSWD_RL78_DTC[]
This defines the value for RL78 Window Mode.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121() to check if DTC can be set. By architectural decision the DTCs will be set only in Window Mode to avoid settings DTCs during development mode, startup or shutdown.
Value: 0x04 Data Definition Status field
0x01 Startup Mode
0x02 Timeout Mode
0x04 Window Mode
0x08 Shutdown Mode
0x10 Sleep Mode
0x80 SW Development Mode (no Reset will be done)
This defines the length of the data for External Watchdog SPI frame.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121() to give it as parameter for Spi2SysWD_getClientInfo() external interface when getting the WATCHDOG frame and status of data.
Value: 3
This defines the length of the SPI WDG Payload Bytes.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121() when getting the WATCHDOG frame and status of data. It will help to reserve the sufficient number of bytes for storing the pdata - the passed by reference parameter of the Spi2SysWD_getClientInfo().
Value: 6 The number of necessary bytes are the double of SYSWDDIAG_EXTWDG_PAYLOAD_LENGTH_WORDS - as each word consists of two bytes.
This defines a initialization value of 0.

Will be used locally by SysWDDiag_DTC000121() and SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_Init() functions to check the value and initialize variables and counters used to implement the corresponding functionalities for DTC 0121 and the CRC32 initialization.
Value: 0
This defines a max value for a 30 ms timer

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121() to check if the DTC can be set to Qualified. The cyclicity of Diag_Chorus_RL78 is 10 ms In order to implement a 30 ms timer this value will be used to check if the timer reached max value

simplesect.para: Value: 3 In accordance to SWR_ICAS1_GW_7339 the DTC 0x000121 is set to Qualified if the software sends the client info over SPI_GW2WD AND it does not receive an answer within 30 ms for 3 subsequent times.

detaileddescription.para: This defines the value for maximum number of times to send HW version to RL78 after Startup.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_FillDiagInfo() to implement a counter for the number of calls. According to SWR_ICAS1_GW_21243, after Startup, Chorus shall send cyclically the HW version to RL78 via Diagnostic Buffer until positive feedback is received from RL78. Based on the SWA if no feedback is received for more than 10 calls, we have to consider other requests and will send again the HW version later. For details see: VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Dynamic.Output frames priority (ICAS1evo)
Value: 10
This defines the value for maximum number of times to send DTC feedback to RL78.

This is used locally in function SysWDDiag_FillDiagInfo() to implement a counter that will keep track of how many times the DTC feedback was sent. Based on SWA in order to avoid starvation due to continuous DTCs requests, the DTC feedback should be sent for maximum 10 times in a row if other requests are present for CRC32 or DTC sync request. For details see: VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Dynamic.Output frames priority (ICAS1evo)
Value: 10

briefdescription.para: DiagInfo Header ID for RL78 SW version.
DiagInfo Header ID for RL78 FBL version.
DiagInfo Header ID for Trace information.
DiagInfo Header ID for Voltage Measurements.
DiagInfo Header ID for Resync request of all DTCs.
DiagInfo Header ID for RL78 HW version.
DiagInfo Header ID for CRC32 calculation.

detaileddescription.para: This defines the used IDs of the DiagInfo frame.

The Diagnostic Info Data is a shared area that can contain different kind of information, such as SW versions, DTC(s), resync response and other. This enum defines what kind of diagnostic information can be provided in the diagnostic data based on the InfoID of the Header.
This will be used in the SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() function to process the data received from RL78, and to take specific actions based on the identified HeaderID.

briefdescription.para: Received DTC from RL78 should be reset - function Dem_SetEventStatus() to be called with parameter DEM_EVENT_STATUS_PASSED.
Received DTC from RL78 should be set - - function Dem_SetEventStatus() to be called with parameter DEM_EVENT_STATUS_FAILED.

detaileddescription.para: This defines the statuses of received DTCs.

If valid DTCs are received from RL78 the SysWDdiagnosis will extract the DTC ID and the status of each DTC from DiagInfo frame and will call the corresponding interface Dem_SetEventStatus() to set or reset DTCs according to status. This will be used in the SysWDDiag_setDTCEventStatus() function that will handle the setting of DTC(s).
There are two possible statuses of the received DTC(s) - to be set or reset.

briefdescription.para: Initial state - no CRC request has been sent.
A request for CRC calculation has to be sent to RL78.
A request for CRC calculation has been sent to RL78 and now the answer is waited.
A valid CRC calculation has been received from RL78.
No valid CRC calculation has been received from RL78.

detaileddescription.para: This defines the types of the local state for the CRC requests.

In order to keep track of the current status for the CRC requests to RL78 we will implement a state machine. This enum will be used to declare and define a state variable SysWDDiag_CRC32_State that will be used in this scope. In function SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_CrcReq() the states will be checked and used in order to give feedback to CRC Manager and take specific action based on the type of the request and the current local state.
There are 5 possible local states for the CRC request to be handled and updated by SysWDDiagnosis component.
This defines the list of DTC hex values.

This is used locally to handle the received DTC(s) from RL78. When a valid DTC is found, the received hex value of the DTC should correspond to one of the values defined in this enum. This will be checked in function SysWDDiag_setDTCEventStatus(), which will handle also the mapping and setting of the DTC(s) with corresponding DEM values/interfaces.
The list of the RL78 possible DTC(s) is given by architectural elements. See VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Dynamic.Handling of RL78 DTCs
This defines the type of flags needed for handling the Chorus - RL78 communication data.

This structure is used locally to define a variable SysWDDiag_AllFlags that will store the corresponding flags when receiving, processing and sending back the data to RL78.
There are 5 flags used by SysWDDiagnosis to handle the Chorus - RL78 communication.

memberdef.name: SYSWD_RL78_DTC
memberdef.initializer: = { {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_101, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000101, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_102, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000102, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_104, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000104, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_109, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000109, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_10A, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_00010A, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_10C, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_00010C, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_10D, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_00010D, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_120, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000120, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_150, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000150, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_151, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000151, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_153, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000153, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_155, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000155, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_156, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000156, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_157, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000157, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_158, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_000158, 0}, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_1A2, Dem_RL78_DemEventId_0001A2, 1 }, {SYSWD_DTC_VAL_1B2, Dem_DemEventId_0001B2 , 1 } }

detaileddescription.para: Mapping the DTC 3-byte values from diagnostic info SPI frame to defined values for DTCs

This constant will be used locally in function SysWDDiag_setDTCEventStatus() that handles the setting of the DTC(s) received from RL78. For each hex value there is a corresponding DEM value, and the type of the DTC
erasable or not. The mapping is necessary in order to set/reset DTC(s) using DEM interface Dem_SetEventStatus().
There are 17 possible DTC(s) that have to be handled - N_DEFINED_DTCS The list of the RL78 possible DTC(s) is given by architectural elements. See VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Dynamic.Handling of RL78 DTCs
Buffer to store RL78 Voltage measurements.

This is a local variable used for storing the Voltage Measurements received from RL78. The content of the buffer will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() function and will be read by SysWDDiag_ReadRL78Voltage() function when the data is requested by other components.
range The buffer is an array of 9 uint8 values The values are 7 different measurements with ADC filtered values (70 bits used) from a frame with 9 bytes (72 bits) - under following buffer layout:
VDD_0V8 - 10 bits - start position bit 0 ... 9
VDD_DVFS - 10 bits - start position bit 10 ... 19
VDD_DDR_1V1 - 10 bits - start position bit 20 ... 29
VDD_DDR_1V8 - 10 bits - start position bit 30 ... 39
VDD_1V8 - 10 bits - start position bit 40 ... 49
VDD_2V5 - 10 bits - start position bit 50 ... 59
VDD_3V3_SW - 10 bits - start position bit 60 ... 69 unit Voltage context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame(), SysWDDiag_ReadRL78Voltage(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Variable to store RL78 Temperature.

This is a local variable used for storing the Temperature received from RL78. The content of the variable will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() function and will be read by SysWDDiag_ReadRL78Temperature() function when the data is requested by other components.
range The variable is of type uint16 values The temperature is provided as Celsius. Negative values are supported. unit Celsius context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame(), SysWDDiag_ReadRL78Temperature(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
DiagInfo receive buffer

This is a local variable to be used for receiving and storing the information from DiagInfo SPI frame The content of the buffer will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() function and will be read by other functions of the current module to extract and process the containing info from RL78.
range The buffer is an array of 5 uint16 values The values will be taken from DiagnosticInfoData unit Could be temperature, voltage measurements, SW version, FBL version and others - depending on the HeaderID context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
DiagInfo send buffer

This is a local variable used for storing the information to be sent to RL78. The content of the buffer will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_ExtractDTCs() function and will be read by SysWDDiag_FillDiagInfo() function when sending the data.
range The buffer is an array of 5 uint16 values The values will contain feedback information and DTCs unit The content of the buffer will match DiagnosticInfoData context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_ExtractDTCs(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Variable used for storing various flags related to Chorus - RL78 communication data.

This is a local variable used to implement the flags for:
DTC feedback
DTC cleared
RL78 SW error
RL78 FBL error
HW version received by RL78
RL78 Voltage error
RL78 Temperature error
range There are 5 flags stored with this variable values SYSWD_FLAG_OFF and SYSWD_FLAG_ON unit N/A. context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, "Updated an read in the current module inside the functions that send and process the received data from RL78"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Buffer to store RL78 SW version.

This is a local variable used for storing the SW version received from RL78. The content of the buffer will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78SWVersion() function and will be read by SysWDDiag_ReadRL78SWVersion() function when the data is requested by other components.
range The buffer is an array of 4 uint8 values The values represent four ASCII characters representing the SW version unit ASCII characters forming the SW version context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78SWVersion(), SysWDDiag_ReadRL78SWVersion(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Buffer to store RL78 FBL version.

This is a local variable used for storing the FBL version received from RL78. The content of the buffer will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78FBLVersion() function and will be read by SysWDDiag_ReadRL78FBLVersion() function when the data is requested by other components.
range The buffer is an array of 4 uint8 values The values represent four ASCII characters representing the FBL version unit ASCII characters forming the FBL version context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78FBLVersion(), SysWDDiag_ReadRL78FBLVersion(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Variable to store RL78 CRC32 calculation.

This is a local variable used for storing the CRC32 calculation received from RL78. The content of the variable will be updated inside the SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_Init() and SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() functions and will be read by SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_CrcReq() function when the data is requested by CRC manager component.
range The variable is of type uint32 values The CRC32 calculation is provided by RL78 unit CRC calculation result context {Background_C2 OsTask on Core2, SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_Init(), SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_CrcReq(), "The variable is initialized and read by CRC Manager" context {LinTask on Core1, SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame(), "The variable is written inside the cyclic function when data is received from RL78" } protection {local, "This is a local variable and is written only in the context of LinTask - cyclic function #SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame()"}
Variable to store the state of the request for CRC32 calculation.

This is a local variable used to implement a state machine for handling the CRC32 calculation request from RL78. The variable will be initialized inside the SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_Init() and will be updated in SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_CrcReq() function based on the type of the request form CRC Manager. When sending the data to RL78 in SysWDDiag_FillDiagInfo() function, this local state will be checked to decide if a request for CRC32 calculation need to be sent. Also when receiving and processing the data from RL78 inside the SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() if the Header ID indicates that contains CRC calculation this state variable will be updated based on the result - valid CRC received or error status will be set.
range The variable is of type T_CRC_Local_State values The local state for CRC32 can have the following values:
SYSWD_CRC_INIT
SYSWD_CRC_SEND_REQUEST
SYSWD_CRC_WAIT_RESPONSE
SYSWD_CRC_VALID_CRC
SYSWD_CRC_ERROR unit State of the CRC32 request context {Background_C2 OsTask on Core2, SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_Init(), SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_CrcReq(), "The variable is initialized, written and read by CRC Manager"} context {LinTask on Core1, SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame(), SysWDDiag_FillDiagInfo(), "The variable is written and read inside the cyclic functions when data is received and send from/to RL78"}
protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module. Variable is written and read both in Core1 and Core2 but the access is atomic (the cache is disabled)"}
Variable used to count the correctly received responses from RL78 via SPI.

This is a local variable used in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121() when checking the 
 conditions for setting the DTC as De-Qualified: SWR_ICAS1_GW_7339. 
range The variable is of type uint8 
 values Counter incremented and reset to default value SYSWDDIAG_INIT 
 unit number of correctly received responses 
 context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_DTC000121(), "Updated an read in the current module"} 
 protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Variable used to store the External Watchdog message counter.
Variable used for counting invalid or not received response from RL78 via SPI.

This is a local variable used in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121() to check if the DTC can be set to Qualified. In accordance to SWR_ICAS1_GW_7339 the DTC 0x000121 is set to Qualified if the software sends the client info over SPI_GW2WD AND it does not receive an answer within 30 ms for 3 subsequent times.
range The variable is of type uint8. values Variable will be incremented and reset to SYSWDDIAG_INIT in function SysWDDiag_DTC000121(). unit Counter of invalid responses context {LinTask/Diag_Chorus_RL78, SysWDDiag_DTC000121(), "Updated an read in the current module"} protection {local, "This is a local variable in the scope of this module"}
Set DTC event status, DTC and status received as parameters.

simplesect.para: No preconditions
No postconditions

reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: uint32 eventDtcId - DTC ID received from the client
[in] - uint8 DtcStatus - status of the DTC received

simplesect.para: Std_ReturnType - E_OK(0) or E_NOT_OK(1)

simplesect.title: Globals
simplesect.para: SYSWD_RL78_DTC[]

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: The function will be called in the context of SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() after extracting the DTC ID and the status of the DTC from DiagInfo frame. Depending on the data length there could be 1 or 2 DTCs. This function will map the the DTC ID received with defined value from DEM and will call the corresponding interface Dem_SetEventStatus() to set/reset/clear DTCs according to status.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_setDTCEventStatus

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Satisfies following DOORS Requirements and Design Decision:

xrefdescription.para: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11545, SWR_ICAS1_GW_11546, SWR_ICAS1_GW_11548, SWR_ICAS1_GW_11556, SWR_ICAS1_GW_11557, SWR_ICAS1_GW_11558, SWR_ICAS1_GW_11559, SWR_ICAS1_GW_21506, SWR_ICAS1_GW_3313, SWR_ICAS1_GW_3314, SWR_ICAS1_GW_3316, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7333, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7334, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7336, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7337, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7338, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7339, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7345, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7346, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7347, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7348, SWR_ICAS1_GW_7396 Design Decision - Justification. In case of DTC received from RL78 this function will handle the setting/resetting/clearing DTC according to status by sending the corresponding request to DEM.

detaileddescription.para: Extract DTC(s) and status(es) from DiagInfo frame.

This function will:
extract the DTC(s) from the DiagInfo frame (1 or 2, depending on the data length);
extract the status for each DTC;
fill the feedback buffer;
call the function SysWDDiag_setDTCEventStatus() for each DTC;
put the result of setting the DTC(s) in the feedback buffer.
No preconditions
No postconditions
reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
-
uint8 DataLength
void Globals
SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Tx[] Input->Output-Correlation
The function will be called in the context of SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() when the header ID indicates that stores a DTC message. If the DataLength parameter is SYSWD_DTC_INFOLEN1 or SYSWD_DTC_INFOLEN2, indicating that there is 1 or 2 DTCs, the DTC/DTCs and their status will be extracted and the function SysWDDiag_setDTCEventStatus() will be called to handle further to DEM the DTC requests. Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_ExtractDTCs
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to be used in case of DTC received from RL78 - needed to extract the DTC(s), their status, and to update the feedback buffer.
This function extracts the RL78 SW version from DiagInfo and stores it in a buffer.
If the header of Diagnostic Info frame indicates an Info ID related to SW version, this function will be called to extract and store this information in dedicated buffer SysWDDiag_RL78_SW_ver[]

simplesect.para: The InfoId in the DiagInfo header is 0x01
No postconditions

reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: DataLength - Info length of the headerDiagInfo

simplesect.para: void

simplesect.title: Globals
simplesect.para: SysWDDiag_RL78_SW_ver[] SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] SysWDDiag_AllFlags

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: The function will be called in the context of SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() when the header ID indicates that stores SW version info. If the DataLength parameter is SYSWD_LEN_RL78 the SW version will be extracted from receive buffer SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] and copied in a dedicated buffer for SW version SysWDDiag_RL78_SW_ver[]

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78SWVersion

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to process and store the data received from RL78 related to SW version.

detaileddescription.para: This function extracts the RL78 FBL version from DiagInfo and stores it in a buffer.
If the header of Diagnostic Info frame indicates an Info ID related to FBL version, this function will be called to extract and store this information in dedicated buffer SysWDDiag_RL78_FBL_ver[]

simplesect.para: The InfoId in the DiagInfo header is 0x02
No postconditions

reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: DataLength - Info length of the headerDiagInfo

simplesect.para: void

simplesect.title: Globals
simplesect.para: SysWDDiag_RL78_FBL_ver[] SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] SysWDDiag_AllFlags

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: The function will be called in the context of SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame() when the header ID indicates that stores FBL version info. If the DataLength parameter is SYSWD_LEN_RL78 the FBL version will be extracted from receive buffer SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] and copied in a dedicated buffer for SW version SysWDDiag_RL78_FBL_ver[]

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_ExtractRL78FBLVersion

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to process and store the data received from RL78 related to FBL version.

detaileddescription.para: This function handles the DTC 0x000121 - SPI interface to GW defective.

The DTC 0x000121 is set as Qualified when the software sends the client info over SPI_GW2WD AND it does not receive an answer within 30 ms for 3 subsequent times. The DTC is set as De-Qualified after 3 subsequent client info over SPI_GW2WD answers. Setting and resetting the DTC is done by calling the DEM interface Dem_SetEventStatus().

simplesect.para: No preconditions
No postconditions

reentrant: No context: LinTask task thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
void

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: There is no correlation of input data to output data for this function. When called, the function will check the conditions for setting and resetting the DTC 0x000121 by using counters and global variables and if necessary will call the corresponding DEM interface to set the DTC as Qualified or De-Qualified.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_DTC000121

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Satisfies following DOORS Requirement and Design Decision:

xrefdescription.para: SWR_ICAS1_GW_7339 Design Decision - Justification. This function implements the following architectural element: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Dynamic.WDG communication DTC 0x000121"

detaileddescription.para: Analyze and process the DiagInfo frame received from RL78.

The Diagnostic Info Data is a shared area that can contain different kind of information, such as SW versions, DTC(s), resync response and others. This function will process this data based on the InfoID - which are the 4 msb of the Diagnostic Info Header.

simplesect.para: N/A
N/A

reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
void

simplesect.title: Globals
simplesect.para: SysWDDiag_Temp - Temperature from RL78 SysWDDiag_Voltage[] - Voltage from RL78 SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Rx[] - Receive buffer SysWDDiag_AllFlags - Flag for status of received HW version SysWDDiag_CRC32 - CRC32 value received from RL78 SysWDDiag_CRC32_State - State of the request for CRC32

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: The DiagInfo frame and status of data will be processed and different actions will be taken based on the InfoID from the header byte of the DiagInfo. The frame ID could indicate a Resync Response, DTC, CRC32 calculation and others.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_AnalyzeRL78DiagInfoFrame

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Satisfies following DOORS Requirements and Design Decision:

xrefdescription.para: SWR_ICAS1_GW_21252 SWR_ICAS1_GW_21305 SWR_ICAS1_GW_7596 This function is also given by architectural requirements: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Static.Interfaces" Design Decision - Justification. This is the cyclic function for receiving and processing the data from RL78. Based on this Data the Chorus will react accordingly.

detaileddescription.para: Fill the DiagInfo buffer with HW version, feedback data or requests for CRC32 and resync.

This function will:
Fill the SPI send buffer with 0 if nothing needs to be sent;
Fill the SPI send buffer with HW version in the first 10 calls from startup or if there is no feedback that HW version was received;
Fill the SPI send buffer with feedback data if the DTCfeedback flag is set (but not more than 10 times in a row if there are other requests), and clear the flag;
Fill the SPI send buffer with CRC32 request and update the local state;
Fill the SPI send buffer with the DTC resync request if a resync response is not received;
No preconditions
No postconditions
reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint16
sendDiagInfo - Points to the address where the SPI send buffer will copy the data
uint16
sendDiagInfoLen - length of the data to be sent
void Globals
SysWDDiag_DiagInfo_Tx[] SysWDDiag_AllFlags SysWDDiag_CRC32_State
Input->Output-Correlation
The output data in sendDiagInfo location will be updated based on the local state of the requests, status of flags and Output frames priority described in SWA. For details see: VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Dynamic.Output frames priority (ICAS1evo)
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method will be described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_FillDiagInfo

This is an external interface defined in SWA to be called by Spi2SysWD component that handles the communication between Chorus and RL78.
This function copies the RL78 hardware version in the variable given as parameter.

The RL78 HW version will be read from Chorus HSI component using defined SWA interface HardwareVersion_GetHardwareVersionNumber(). This function will take this HW version and will copy the high and low ASCII values into the given parameter.

simplesect.para: No preconditions
No postconditions

reentrant: No context: DiagTask task thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Std_ReturnType - E_OK - HW version correctly retrieved and E_NOT_OK - HW version not available

simplesect.title: Globals
simplesect.para: N/A.

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: If the given parameter is not null pointer, the function will get the HW version from Chorus HSI, will copy this HW version into the given parameter and will return E_OK, otherwise the function will return E_NOT_OK.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_ReadRL78HWVersion

This function initializes the information regarding the CRC.

This is an external function to be called by CRC32 manager component. The function will initialize the data regarding the CRC32 calculation
namely the CRC value and the local state of the RL78 CRC request.

No postconditions

simplesect.para: This function is given by architectural requirements: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Static.Interfaces" Design Decision - Justification. This is an external interface defined in SWA to be called by CRC32_mng component when the information regarding CRC should be initialized.

detaileddescription.para: This function will request/retrieve the CRC from RL78 via SPI.

This is an external function to be called by CRC32 manager. Based on the request type from CRC32_mng and the local status of the CRC32 communication with RL78, the function will send new requests for CRC32 calculation, will write the previously received CRC32 value if available, and will return one of the statuses from T_CrcWdg_Status

simplesect.para: No preconditions
No postconditions

reentrant: No context: Background_C2 OsTask on Core2 thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

parameterdescription.para: - Type of the request from CRC manager
- Points to the address, the CRC result should be stored

simplesect.para: T_CrcWdg_Status retVal - Status of CRC calculation from RL78

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: Based on the request type from CRC32_mng and the current local status of the CRC32 request to RL78, the function will either send new requests to RL78, or will read the already received CRC32 value.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method will be described in SWATT TEST_SysWDDiag_CrcWdg_CrcReq

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Satisfies following DOORS Requirements and Design Decision:

xrefdescription.para: SWR_ICAS1_GW_21244 SWR_ICAS1_GW_21305 This function is also given by architectural requirements: EA path: "VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.Diag_Chorus_RL78.SW Architecture.Static.Interfaces" Design Decision - Justification. This is an external interface defined in SWA to be called by CRC32_mng component when needs to retrieve/request CRC from RL78.

briefdescription.para: This module provides the implementation for the SysWDDiagnosis component.

detaileddescription.para:
Handles the processing of data used for communication between Chorus and RL78. This module checks the DiagInfo frame received from RL78 and:
Provides HW version at startup and checks for feedback
Requests the CRC32 calculation and provides the data to CRC manager
If DTC(s) received : sets DTCs and sends feedback to RL78
If DLT trace - call function that outputs it to console
If resync response - sets active DTCs if any When DTC(s) are cleared by client a resync request is sent to RL78 Verification criteria
Include own header files in the testcase file (SWATT), no stubs for data types and function prototypes. Add software requirement IDs in the testcases.
